/config.description: Choose a Share for handbrake configuration. Eg: create a Share called handbrake-config for this purpose alone.
/config.label: Config Storage

/storage.description: Choose a Share for handbrake that contains files from your host that need to be accessible by the application Eg: create a Share called handbrake-storage for this purpose alone.
/storage.label: Movies location

/watch.description: Choose a Share for handbrake videos to be automatically converted are located. Eg: create a Share called handbrake-watch for this purpose alone.
/watch.label: Watch Storage

/output.description: Choose a Share for handbrake to automatically converted video files are written. Eg: create a Share called handbrake-output for this purpose alone.
/output.label: Output Storage

USER_ID.description: Enter a valid UID to run handbrake as. It must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
USER_ID.label: UID to run handbrake as.

GROUP_ID.description: Enter a valid GID to use along with the above UID. It(or the above UID) must have full permissions to all Shares mapped in the previous step.
GROUP_ID.label: GID to run handbrake as.

HandBrake.description:
Handbrake for converting video from nearly any format to a selection of modern, widely supported codecs.

This docker image makes handbrake accessible through your browser HOSTNAME:5900 or VNC, see more info for details.

Based on the jlesage/handbrake docker image: https://hub.docker.com/r/jlesage/handbrake.
HandBrake.more_info:
Additional volumes can be added to provide extra watch folders.

Documentation on how to access using VNC, adding security and configuring extra watch folders can be found here https://github.com/jlesage/docker-handbrake#accessing-the-gui
